snippet: Within eyeshot of a proposed dam project near Cochrane, Chile, is the entrance to a different view of the region’s destiny: the 660,000-acre Patagonia National Park.
abstract: Cochrane Journal; Cochrane, Chile, is a remote hamlet that for generations nurtured a bucolic, if insular, existence where little changed, on the wide open Patagonian steppe; now a $10 billion hydroelectric dam project is within eyeshot of the 660,000-acre Patagonia National Park; the two competing visions are set so close to each other that they seem to be squaring off in a blatant ideological battle, leaving local residents struggling to grasp where they fit in.
lead_paragraph: Within eyeshot of a proposed dam project near Cochrane, Chile, is the entrance to a different view of the region’s destiny: the 660,000-acre Patagonia National Park.

headline.print_headline: In Patagonia, Caught Between Visions of the Future
headline.main: In Patagonia, Caught Between Visions of the Future
